name: Gnome Shell Extension - Title to Panel

screenshots.caption: Showing the title of a maximized window in the top bar of the GNOME shell.
The title of the maximized window, that is placed highest in the window stack, can be still shown in the top panel, even when an other, not maximized window, is focused.
When only the titles of maximized windows should be shown in the top panel of the GNOME shell, the the panel remains empty when no window is maximized.

The extension allows to show only the titles of windows, that are located on a specific screen, in the top panel of the GNOME shell. So the title in the top panel will be kept even if a window is focused on another screen.
The preferences dialog of the extension.

short_description: The gnome shell extension "Title to Panel" is a fork of the extension "Status Title Bar", which allows to display the full title of the currently selected window in the top panel of the GNOME shell. Unlike the original extension, it is possible, that only maximized windows, which are located on the screen, which contains the top panel, will be considered due to better multi-monitor support.
summary: Shows the current window's title in the top panel of the GNOME shell
